greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Run Length Transform of swinging factorials (A056040).
comment: For the definition of the Run Length Transform see A246595.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
formula: a(2^n-1) = n$ where n$ is the swinging factorial of n, A056040(n).
mathematica: f[n_] := n!/Quotient[n, 2]!^2; Table[Times @@ (f[Length[#]]&) /@ Select[ Split[ IntegerDigits[n, 2]], #[[1]] == 1&], {n, 0, 85}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 11 2017 *)
program: A246661_list = lambda len: RLT(lambda n: factorial(n)/factorial(n//2)^2, len)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Sep 07 2014
